Content:: One-day races and Classics Felix Großschartner (born 23 December 1993) is an Austrian cyclist, who currently rides for UCI WorldTeam Bora–Hansgrohe.[4] Born in Wels, Großschartner turned professional in 2012 with RC Arbö–Wels–Gourmetfein. In 2016, he joined UCI Professional Continental team CCC–Sprandi–Polkowice. With this team, he competed in his first Grand Tour: the 2017 Giro d'Italia.[5] In September 2017, Großschartner signed a contract to ride for the Bora–Hansgrohe team in the 2018 season.[6] In April 2019, Großschartner took his first overall stage race victory at the Presidential Tour of Turkey, having won the summit finish to the ski resort south of Kartepe.[7][8] In August 2019, he was named in the start list for the Vuelta a España.[9] In August 2020, he was named in the start list for the Tour de France.[10] He achieved his best result in a Grand Tour later that season, by finishing the Vuelta a España in ninth place overall.[11] He was again selected by Bora–Hansgrohe as their primary general classification contender for the 2021 Vuelta a España, and he finished in tenth place overall.[12] In 2022, Großschartner took his first senior national championship titles, winning both the Austrian National Road Race Championships and the Austrian National Time Trial Championships.[13]
Title: Felix Großschartner - Wikipedia
